intro: Quartinia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian quartinia, is a species of flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
